name: Vigo
fun_fact: Fun fact: Vigo has one of the finest natural ports in the world and is Spain's seafood capital! The C칤es Islands offshore were called 'the islands of the gods' by Romans, and Rodas Beach was named 'The best beach in the world' by The Guardian in 2007!

hero_dishes.name: Pulpo a Feira (Pulpo a la Gallega)
hero_dishes.description: The undeniable star of Galician cuisine - boiled octopus dressed with olive oil and piment칩n (paprika), served with boiled potatoes. A relatively simple dish that showcases the exceptional quality of Galician octopus.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Also known as 'octopus Galician-style' or 'pulpo a la feria,' this dish represents Galicia's mastery of preparing octopus. The coastal upwelling phenomenon makes Vigo's waters exceptionally rich in nutrients, producing unequalled seafood quality.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Restaurante Casa Marco (famous for Galician-style octopus), Restaurante Casa Vella (family-run, exceptional pulpo a la gallega), Taberna Eligio (perfectly tender pulpo  feira), Restaurant O Porton on Rua da Ostras/Fisherman's Street (pulpo for 16 euros)

hero_dishes.name: Fresh Galician Seafood
hero_dishes.description: Life revolves around the sea in Vigo - mussels, scallops, bay scallops, clams, velvet crab, spider crab, Norway lobster, lobster, and the prized barnacles (percebes) when in season. Many say it's the best seafood on earth.
hero_dishes.origin_story: The exceptionally high quality is due to coastal upwelling phenomenon making the waters extremely rich in nutrients. Seafood caught in the estuaries near Vigo is unequalled in Spain in terms of quality, appearance, and flavor.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Bitadorna (traditional seafood: lobster, red prawns, octopus), Casco Vello and O Berb칠s neighborhoods (oysters from A Pedra, velvet crabs, spider crab, gooseneck barnacles)

hero_dishes.origin_story: R칰a da Pescader칤a (also called Oyster Street) represents Vigo's seafood culture at its most authentic - vendors shuck oysters fresh and pair them with local wine.

hero_dishes.name: Caldo Gallego
hero_dishes.description: A hearty Galician soup made with greens, chorizo, and beans - warming comfort food from the region.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Traditional Galician soup that reflects the region's rustic, hearty approach to food.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Traditional Galician restaurants throughout Vigo, especially in older neighborhoods

signature_drinks.name: Albari침o Wine
signature_drinks.description: Crisp white wine produced from Albari침o grapes with subtle hints of citrus and fruit, making it perfect for pairing with fish and seafood.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served chilled with fresh oysters on Oyster Street, or paired with pulpo a feira and other seafood dishes. Locals drink it throughout meals at seafood restaurants.
